In case my supervisor needs to contact you, it would be helpful if we could have your telephone number.
ADD IF NECESSARY: Your 'phone number will not be passed to anyone outside the National Centre.

How was the supplementary questionnaire administered?
Completed by the respondent while you were present
Left with respondent, to be collected by you
Left with respondent, to be returned by post
QUESTIONS ON THE INTERVIEW AS A WHOLE:
Did the respondent ask for clarification on any questions?
Did you feel that the respondent was reluctant to answer any questions?
Did you feel that the respondent tried to answer the questions to the best of his or her ability?
Overall, did you feel that the respondent understood the questions?
Was anyone else present, who interfered with the interview?
If you have any additional comments on the interview, please write them in.

Using this card, generally speaking, would you say that most people can be trusted, or that you can't be too careful in dealing with people?
Please tell me on a score of 0 to 10, where 0 means you can't be too careful and 10 means that most people can be trusted.

Most people would try to take advantage of me
Most people would try to be fair
Now we want to ask a few questions about politics and government.
How interested would you say you are in politics - are you ...
Some people don't vote nowadays for one reason or another.
Did you vote in the last (British) general election (in the UK) in June 2001?
... worked in a political party or action group?
How often does politics seem so complicated that you can't really understand what is going on?
Do you think that you could take an active role in a group involved with political issues?
On the whole how satisfied are you with the present state of the economy in (Britain/The UK)?
Now thinking about the (British) government (of the UK), how satisfied are you with the way it is doing its job?
And on the whole, how satisfied are you with the way democracy works in (Britain/The UK)?
How difficult or easy do you find it to make your mind up about political issues?
Using this card, please say to what extent you agree or disagree with each of the following statements: The less that government intervenes in the economy, the better it is for (Britain/The UK).
The (British/UK) government should take measures to reduce differences in income levels.
Employees need strong trade unions to protect their working conditions and wages.
Gay men and lesbians should be free to live their own life as they wish
Using this card, please tell me on a score of 0 to 10 how much you personally trust each of the institutions I read out.
0 means you do not trust an institution at all, and 10 means you have complete trust.
Regardless of whether you belong to a particular religion, how religious would you say you are?
Using this card, how often do you meet socially with friends, relatives or work colleagues?
Do you have anyone with whom you can discuss intimate and personal matters?
How safe do you - or would you - feel walking alone in this area after dark?
How is your health in general?
Using this card, would you say that people who come to live here generally take jobs away from workers in (Britain/the UK), or generally help to create new jobs?
Do you have any friends who have come to live in the UK from another country?
Out of every 100 people living in (Britain/the UK), how many do you think were born outside (Britain/the UK)?
How many employees (if any) do you have?
Which of the descriptions on this card comes closest to how you feel about your household's income nowadays?
Which of the descriptions on this card applies to what he has been doing for the last 7 days?
In paid work (or away temporarily) (employee, self-employed, working for your family business)
In education, even if on vacation, (not paid for by employer)
Unemployed and actively looking for a job
Unemployed, wanting a job but not actively looking for a job
Doing housework, looking after children or other persons
